CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 14, 1945, pg. 2, reads: "Furlough - Sgt. George Charlton Jr. is home on furlough from Europe.  He wears two Bronze Stars and a Good Conduct ribbon.  His family lives on Reed Street."Stripes on sleeve denote overseas service, one stripe per 6 months of service; ribbons over jacket pocket denote good conduct and 2 Bronze Stars
TitMainTitle: Three quarter portrait of Sergeant George Charlton wearing U. S. Army uniform with Medical Corps insignia on lapels, and Technician fourth grade patch on sleeve, posed in front of light colored background, in Harris Studio
